review: Move over Gary Busey, this little gem is the real deal.Extremely well packaged, very Apple like in packaging, well thought out with a cartoon tutorial to avoid the usual reading one must do to learn how to work the system which is often written poorly at best.Plus, you can download to your smart phone and application that virtually replaces the well-thought-out remote that comes with the fire stick and allows voice commands for all requests of the system.It is simply the shizel!System is easy to use, quick and effortless to link up with router and install.If you're looking for something to stream movies and you're not currently set up with something, bang for buck and quality… This is a no-brainer.
author: mark nutter

review: I've had a Roku for years, so I've had it easy.  The Fire Stick is a PITA to set up if you don't broadcast your SSID, claims it's buffering (I work for Comcast, so pretty sure my internet is fast and reliable), and difficult as heck to scroll around to find what you need.  I'm not talking to my remote because that's just nuts, so haven't tried that feature.  I do like the auto-play with Netflix and Crackle, but that's like saying I like the garnish that was on my dinner plate.  Looking forward to losing a small, black remote any day now, too. At least with the Roku remote, you could look for the little purple tag.  Can't believe I waited weeks for this.
